alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 3:28PM PDT until May 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, flooding will occur at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road. Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 19.0 feet this evening and again on Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM PDT.
